case_title: A. Q. SHAUKAT AND Another vs S. M. JAFAR
complaint_summary: The respondent alleged that the petitioner forcibly occupied two flats (Nos. 1 and 2, New Charli Villa, Murree) and sought action under Section 145 of the Criminal Procedure Code.
investigation_summary: The Sub-Divisional Magistrate initially ordered attachment of the property but vacated the order citing lack of jurisdiction over evacuee properties. The respondent filed a fresh application to the District Magistrate, who referred it to the Additional District Magistrate. The latter issued notices and ordered attachment of the flats pending resolution.

judgment_summary.reasoning: Jurisdiction of criminal courts barred under Section 25 of the Displaced Persons Act.

appellant: Sections 7, 25, and 29 of the Displaced Persons Act bar criminal court jurisdiction.
Acquisition by the government does not change the jurisdictional bar.
Sub-Divisional Magistrate's earlier order prevents fresh applications.
Attachment order lacks justification for emergency conditions.
respondent: Criminal Procedure Code has broad jurisdiction.
Sections 7, 25, and 29 do not bar criminal court jurisdiction.
Attachment order complies with Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Revisional jurisdiction should not interfere lightly.

assets: Two flats (Nos. 1 and 2, New Charli Villa, Murree)

property_details.location: New Charli Villa near Pindi Point, Murree

statutes: Pakistan Administration of Evacuee Property Ordinance, 1949
sections: Sections 7, 25, and 29 of the Displaced Persons Act
Section 30 of the Displaced Persons Act
key_issues: Jurisdiction of criminal courts over evacuee property
Validity of orders under Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Competency of fresh applications under Section 145, Cr. P.C.
Impact of evacuee property acquisition by the government
Conditions for ad interim attachment of property

court_findings.jurisdiction: Section 25 of the Displaced Persons Act bars criminal court jurisdiction over evacuee property disputes.
court_findings.attachment_order: Magistrate not required to state grounds for emergency under second proviso of Section 145, Cr. P.C.
court_findings.fresh_application: Additional District Magistrate's order valid as Sub-Divisional Magistrate did not decide on merits.

legal_terms.Evacuee Property: Property abandoned by individuals who migrated during partition.
legal_terms.Jurisdiction: Authority of a court to hear a case.

words_and_phrases.Ad interim attachment: Temporary seizure of property pending a final decision.
words_and_phrases.Breach of peace: A situation likely to disturb public tranquility.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the jurisdiction of criminal courts under Section 145, Cr. P.C., in disputes involving evacuee properties. The court held that Section 25 of the Displaced Persons Act barred such jurisdiction. The petition challenging the orders of the Additional District Magistrate was allowed.
